thread.title_full: Big Ten football | Maryland fires coach Randy Edsall | Buckeye Xtra Sports

title: Big Ten football | Maryland fires coach Randy Edsall | Buckeye Xtra Sports
text:
Maryland fired coach Randy Edsall, less than 24 hours after the Terrapins’ 49-28 loss to Ohio State — their third straight lopsided defeat.
The dismissal comes in the middle of Edsall’s fifth season with the Terps. He was 22-34 since taking over in 2011.
Maryland (2-4, 0-2 Big Ten) has been outscored 122-34 during its three-game losing streak. Including an earlier defeat against Bowling Green, Maryland’s four losses have come by an average of four touchdowns.
>>  Dispatch  sports editor Ray Stein answers your questions about Buckeyes football during our weekly chat, 1 p.m. Thursday, dispatch.com/osuchat 
“We appreciate Randy’s tireless commitment to the University of Maryland,” athletic director Kevin Anderson said in a statement. “This was a difficult decision, but ultimately this is the best course of action for our football program moving forward.”
Offensive coordinator Mike Locksley will take over on an interim basis. Maryland has a bye this week before facing Penn State in Baltimore on Oct. 24.
Locksley coached at New Mexico from 2009 to 2011, going 2-26, before returning to Maryland in 2012.
Edsall, 57, received a contract extension in June that was to begin in January 2017 and was worth up to $7.5 million — though only $500,000 was guaranteed.
